Yasuo's bug was nowhere near game breaking - it added a small amount of damage to his ult. It was hardly noticeable unless you knew about it, and the vast majority of players - including Yasuo mains - were unaware it even existed until it was fixed. It had low impact on the game, and players would normally not even be aware it was happening when it occurred. It was not a bannable offense.

Xerath's is a very difficult bug to reproduce - you have to stand in a very specific spot in order to use it. When it is used, it is clearly intentional, and no one is going to do it on accident. It is extremely game breaking and is a guaranteed win for the user. _That_ is a bannable offense - in fact, Meddler has confirmed that a number of players have already been perma-banned for it.

For your Ahri scenario, that type of bug would warrant an immediate disable of Ahri. It would be impossible for any Ahri player to play a fair match, since it would have a massive impact in every scenario, no matter the Ahri player's intentions. There would be no need for a ban.
